bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: cv::HOGDescriptor and all of its subfunctions not documented in help
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/2618>http://code.opencv.org/issues/2618</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Steven Puttemans on 2012-12-10 14:38 || Priority: Normal || Affected: None || Category: documentation || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: None || PR: || Platform: None / None </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>cv::HOGDescriptor and all of its subfunctions not documented in help</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>As mentioned, when going through the 2.4.3 documentation, the CPU version of the HOG descriptor isn't documented. Only the GPU version is. This is however quite misleading, since the actual HOG example uses the CPU functionality and not the GPU CUDA version.
Maybe possible to add this to the documentation of the next release? </denchmark-code>
